intro: Stenochlaena prieuriana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branching stems and dense clusters of small, tubular flowers. The leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in a fine, velvety texture. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. This plant is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
